Package ohos.eventhandler

Class EventHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.eventhandler.EventHandler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DataAbilityAsyncHandler, EventHandlerEx, RdbStoreAsyncHandler

    public class EventHandler
extends Object
    Allows you to send and process InnerEvent and Runnable objects on asynchronous threads.

    Each EventHandler instance is bound to a thread, and the thread has an event queue. The thread cyclically retrieves events from the event queue and dispatches the events to the EventHandler for processing. The EventHandler delivers an event or a Runnable task to the thread's event queue and executes the event or task when it comes out of the event queue.

    You can use an EventHandler to dispatch and process events and Runnable objects among different threads and to schedule events or Runnable objects to be processed at a certain interval.

    You can use methods provided in this class to send a synchronous or asynchronous event, delay the processing of an event, and set the event priority.

    You need to override the processEvent(ohos.eventhandler.InnerEvent) method to process events.

    Since:
    1

      • sendEvent

        public void sendEvent​(InnerEvent event,
                      long delayTime,
                      EventHandler.Priority priority)
               throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sends a delayed event with a specified priority to the event queue.
        Parameters:
        event - Indicates the InnerEvent to send.
        delayTime - Indicates the time period after which the event will be processed, in milliseconds. The value must be greater than 0. Otherwise, the event will not be delayed.
        priority - Indicates the event priority. For details, see EventHandler.Priority.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid, for example, if event is null or the InnerEvent instance indicated by event has been sent by another EventHandler.
        Since:
        1

      • sendTimingEvent

        public void sendTimingEvent​(InnerEvent event,
                            long taskTime,
                            EventHandler.Priority priority)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sends a scheduled event with a specified priority to the event queue.
        Parameters:
        event - Indicates the InnerEvent to send.
        taskTime - Indicates the scheduled time to trigger the event, in ms. The value must be greater than the current system runtime. Otherwise, the event will be triggered immediately.
        priority - Indicates the event priority. For details, see EventHandler.Priority.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid, for example, if event is null or the InnerEvent instance indicated by event has been sent by another EventHandler.
        Since:
        3

      • sendTimingEvent

        public void sendTimingEvent​(int eventId,
                            long taskTime)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sends a scheduled event containing only the event ID to the event queue. The default priority is EventHandler.Priority#LOW.
        Parameters:
        eventId - Indicates the ID of the event to send. You can set it to any int value.
        taskTime - Indicates the scheduled time to trigger the event, in ms. The value must be greater than the current system runtime. Otherwise, the event will be triggered immediately.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the system fails to use eventId to create an InnerEvent.
        Since:
        3

      • removeAllEvent

        public void removeAllEvent​()
        Removes all waiting events from the EventHandler.

        Waiting events are events that have been sent to the event queue but have not been processed.

        Since:
        1

        Parameters:

        public final EventRunner getEventRunner​()

      • distributeEvent

        public void distributeEvent​(InnerEvent event)
        Distributes a specified InnerEvent.

        If the InnerEvent carries a task, that is, its task attribute is not null, the task will be executed.

        If the InnerEvent does not carry any task, processEvent(ohos.eventhandler.InnerEvent) will be called to process the event.

        Parameters:
        event - Indicates the InnerEvent to distribute.
        Since:
        4

      • processEvent

        protected void processEvent​(InnerEvent event)
        Called for processing events.

        You should override this method to process events sent by the EventHandler.

        Parameters:
        event - Indicates the InnerEvent to process.
        Since:
        1

      • toString

        public String toString​()
        Description copied from class: Object
        Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method.

        The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of: 

         getClass().getName() + '@' + Integer.toHexString(hashCode())
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the object.
